newsitem.title: LEBANON: Bank shares mixed in Beirut.
newsitem.headline: Bank shares mixed in Beirut.

text.p: Banque Audi continued its rise on the Beirut Stock Exchange on Friday for the fourth day but Banque Libanaise pour le Commerce fell for the first time since listing last month.

Audi, which has risen steadily since it began trading on Monday, rose again to $15.875 from Thursday's $15.75. Turnover rose to 25,392 shares from 20,337 but there were no block trades compared with Thursday when 17,100 shares changed hands in block trades on and off the floor.
BLC, which surged after it began trading at $11.25 on December 30, fell to $12.25 on Friday from its high of $12.375. Turnover was 5,000 shares against 2,000 on Thursday.
Banque Audi and Banque Libanaise pour le Commerce are the first two Lebanese banks listed on the Beirut Stock Exchange since it reopened in January 1996.
Solidere A rose on Friday to $10.75 from $10.625 while B shares fell to $10.625 from $11.25.
There was no trade in the four other firms listed on the BSE: Ciments Libanais, Ciments Blancs, Eternit and Uniceramic.
Total BSE volume was 78,765 shares, down from 94,364. Turnover was $980,771.625 against $1,436,212.
The BLOM stock index fell 0.45 percent to 905.06 and the LISPI stock index fell 0.53 percent to 81.31.
